value.description: Copper is a thermally and electrically conductive, non-magnetic metal extracted from Kalcopyrite and Malachite ores.
Tin is an uncommon, low-value metal extracted from cassiterite, the primary ore of tin. While it's not very useful on it's own, it's a component of useful alloys, and can be used to glaze ceramics.
Sterling silver that has been pressed into coins, these see widespread use as the de-facto currency across the Rim.
